snx.framework.graphics

Class SpriteBatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • snx.framework.graphics.SpriteBatch

  • public class SpriteBatch
extends java.lang.Object
    By Waffalz Handles drawing to graphics, for convenience

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                 java.awt.Rectangle destinationRectangle,
                 java.awt.Color color)
        Draws an image
        Parameters:
        img - The Image to be drawn
        destinationRectangle - The location on the graphicsDevice to be drawn to
        color - The color. Duh. Currently this parameter doesn't do anything

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                 java.awt.Rectangle destinationRectangle,
                 java.awt.Rectangle sourceRectangle,
                 java.awt.Color color)
        Draws a specified part of an image to the graphicsDevice
        Parameters:
        img - The Image to be drawn
        destinationRectangle - The location on the graphicsDevice to be drawn to
        sourceRectangle - The part of the image to be drawn
        color - The color. Duh. Currently this parameter doesn't do anything

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                 java.awt.Rectangle destinationRectangle,
                 java.awt.Rectangle sourceRectangle,
                 java.awt.Color color,
                 float rotation,
                 Vector2 origin)
        Draws a specified part of an image to the graphicsDevice, with rotations
        Parameters:
        img - The image to be drawn
        destinationRectangle - The location on the graphicsDevice to be drawn to
        sourceRectangle - The part of the image to be drawn
        color - The color. Duh. Currently this parameter doesn't do anything
        rotation - The angle of the transformed drawing
        origin - The point about which the drawing will be rotated, relative to the position of the source rectangle

      • drawString

        public void drawString(java.awt.Font font,
                       java.lang.String text,
                       Vector2 position,
                       java.awt.Color color)
        Draws text
        Parameters:
        font - The font of the text to be drawn
        text - The text to be drawn
        position - The position at which the text will be drawn
        color - The color of which the text will be drawn

      • drawString

        public void drawString(java.awt.Font font,
                       java.lang.String text,
                       Vector2 position,
                       java.awt.Color color,
                       float rotation,
                       Vector2 origin)
        Draws text
        Parameters:
        font - The font of the text to be drawn
        text - The text to be drawn
        position - The position at which the text will be drawn
        color - The color of which the text will be drawn
        rotation - The angle of rotation at which the text will be drawn
        origin - The point about which the text will be drawn

      • drawRectangle

        public void drawRectangle(java.awt.Rectangle dest,
                          float thickness,
                          java.awt.Color color)
        Draws a Rectangle to the screen
        Parameters:
        dest - The bounds of the SpriteBatch on which the rectangle will appear
        thickness - The line thickness of the rectangle
        color - The line color of the rectangle

      • drawFillRectangle

        public void drawFillRectangle(java.awt.Rectangle dest,
                              java.awt.Color color)
        Draws a rectangle of specified line color
        Parameters:
        dest - The bounds of the rectangle to be drawn to the SpriteBatch
        color - The fill color of the rectangle

      • clear

        public void clear(java.awt.Color c)
        Clears the entire graphics object by filling it with one color
        Parameters:
        c - The color to fill the graphics with

      • getGraphicsDevice

        public java.awt.Graphics2D getGraphicsDevice()
        Returns the graphics device that the SpriteBatch is drawing on
        Returns:
        The SpriteBatch's graphics device

      • printAllFonts

        public static void printAllFonts()
        Prints the list of all fonts available. Mainly used for the developer to pick out fonts
